tit.cmt: 加藤を大文字に訂正しました。

sen.j: 加藤文麗（かとうぶんれい、宝永3年（1706年） - 天明2年3月5日 (旧暦)（1782年4月17日））は江戸時代中期の日本の画家である。
sen.e: Bunrei Kato (1706 - April 17, 1782) was a Japanese painter in the middle of the Edo period.
Bunrei KATO (1706 - April 17, 1782) was a Japanese painter in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 谷文晁の師として知られる。
sen.e: He was known as the master of Buncho TANI.

sen.j: 名前は泰都、幼名は泰高、字を文麗、号 (称号)は豫斎、通称を織之助、左金吾と称した。
sen.e: His name was Yasuto, childhood name was Yasutaka, azana (courtesy name) was Bunrei, go (shogo) (second name or alias) was Yosai, and common name was Orinosuke and Sakingo.

sen.j: 文麗は「寛政重修諸家譜」に載るほどの名門の出身。
sen.e: Bunrei was from such a family of pedigree that he was described in 'Kansei Choshu Shokafu' (genealogies of vassals in Edo bakufu).

sen.j: すなわち伊予国大洲藩第3代藩主加藤泰恒の6男で、一族の加藤泰茂の養嗣子となって家督3千石を継いだ。
sen.e: That is, he was the sixth son of Yasutsune KATO, the third lord of the Ozu Domain, Iyo Province, adopted by Yasushige KATO, one of the families, and inherited the family estate of three thousand goku (crop yields).

sen.j: また子の加藤泰みちは本家の家督を継ぎ大洲藩主となっている。
sen.e: Moreover, Yasumichi KATO, his son, inherited the family estate of the head family and became the lord of the Ozu Domain.

sen.j: 幼少より画を好み、武道の修練の傍らに木挽町狩野の画家（狩野常信のちに狩野周信）について狩野派の画法を学ぶ。
sen.e: Bunrei liked painting since childhood and studied brushwork of the Kano School under the painters in Kano of Kobiki-cho, (first Tsunenobu KANO, later Chikanobu KANO) while training the martial art.
